bug.author: gwk
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have installed streamlit using pip for python3.8rc1. Upon running streamlit hello and visiting the localhost URL, I see the following in a web popup: <denchmark-code>File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/streamlit/hello.py", line 18 from __future__ import division, unicode_literals ^ SyntaxError: from __future__ imports must occur at the beginning of the file </denchmark-code>
Briefly looking at the source for this file, I do not understand what is causing the error. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Install python3.8rc1 on macOS catalina. pip3 install streamlit. Will require Developer Tools and fussing with pillow Zlib dependency. Run streamlit hello. Visit the page.
<denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.47.4 Python version: Python 3.8.0rc1 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? No. OS version: macOS 10.15 Beta (19A582a) Browser version: Safari Version 13.0.2 (15608.2.30.1.1)

comments.comment:
Python 3.8 doesn't work very well for me, but you can get it running by just removing the line above, like so: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/XBattleFan/streamlit/commit/6422cb07e66434f51d86540c5f083ca555532695>XBattleFan@6422cb0</denchmark-link>
Fractals and plotting will work, none of the others.
We have full python 3.8 support now, and we've dropped python 2 support.
